intro: Arabis polyantha, commonly known as the candytuft, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its clustered, fluffy white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has basal leaves that are lobed or toothed. Arabis polyantha is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
